# duplocloud_aws_mq_config (Resource)

`duplocloud_aws_mq_config` manages an configuration for amazon mq managed by Duplo.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "duplocloud_tenant" "myapp" {
  account_name = "myapp"
  plan_id      = "default"
}

resource "duplocloud_aws_mq_config" "c" {
  tenant_id               = duplocloud_tenant.myapp.tenant_id
  name                    = "conf1"
  authentication_strategy = "SIMPLE"
  engine_type             = "ACTIVEMQ"
  engine_version          = "5.18"
}

// Update example: Data can only be updated after config is created
// data must be base64 encoded
resource "duplocloud_aws_mq_config" "c" {
  tenant_id               = duplocloud_tenant.myapp.tenant_id
  name                    = "conf1"
  authentication_strategy = "SIMPLE"
  engine_type             = "ACTIVEMQ"
  engine_version          = "5.18"
  description             = "second version"
  data                    = ""
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `authentication_strategy` (String) Specify authentication strategy, valid values are `SIMPLE`, `LDAP`
- `engine_type` (String) Specify engine type, valid values are `ACTIVEMQ`, `RABBITMQ`
- `engine_version` (String) Specify valid engine version based on engine type
- `name` (String) The name of MQ configuration.
- `tenant_id` (String) The GUID of the tenant that the custom tag for a resource will be created in.

### Optional

- `data` (String) Base64 configuration data, applicable for only updating
- `description` (String) Descritpion of MQ configuration, can be set only during update
- `timeouts` (Block, Optional) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--timeouts))

### Read-Only

- `arn` (String)
- `configuration_id` (String)
- `fullname` (String)
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `latest_version` (Number)
- `tags` (Map of String)

<a id="nestedblock--timeouts"></a>
### Nested Schema for `timeouts`

Optional:

- `create` (String)
- `delete` (String)
- `update` (String)

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Example: Importing an existing AWS MQ configuration
#  - *TENANT_ID* is the tenant GUID
#  - *BROKER_NAME* is the short name of the AWS MQ broker
#  - *BROKER_ID* is the broker ID of the AWS MQ broker

terraform import duplocloud_aws_mq_config.mqconfig *TENANT_ID*/*BROKER_ID*/*BROKER_NAME*
```
